intro: Pherotrichis leptogenia, commonly known as the slender spiny scale, is a species of scale insect belonging to the family Coccidae. It is characterized by its small, elongated body covered in a waxy, protective shield. The plant it infests is typically a woody species, where it feeds on sap, causing potential damage to the host. Its life cycle includes several stages, with the adult female being the most commonly observed. The botanical significance of Pherotrichis leptogenia lies in its role as a pest in certain horticultural and agricultural settings.
